  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25909].
  {panel}

Hi, 
related to issue JRA-9652 where expand/collapse has been implemented for fields, I think it would also be of interest, like in the case of a long Description field, to truncate its contents to maybe 30 lines in the UI and have a 'See more ...' button/link that expands the Description so that you see all its contents. It's nice to have expand/collapse to save on scrolling, but it would be even nicer to see just a bit of the fields' contents as it's sometimes enough to get an idea what's in it.
What do you think ?

Thanks,
Cristian
fields.summary: Better expandable fields

fields.description:
*To Reproduce*
# Restore the attached export in a Jira 4.1.2 (I also reproduced it 100% in 4.3.4 and 4.4.1) (Also, it's pretty easy to set up a Jira instance that will reproduce it.  You just need 2 projects using 2 different workflows and one workflow needs to have at least one state that is different)
# Log in as admin, password admin, or developer, password developer
# Using Bulk Move, move any of the Open issues from the Music project to Doughnuts. 

*Expected Result*
There should be a line saying *Status* _Open -> Started_

*Actual Result*
No Status listed in the History due to the Bulk Move. See screen shot

*Additional Information*
Single Issue Move works as expected
fields.summary: If Bulk Move requires a change in state then there will be no Status change shown in the History

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25898].
  {panel}

This specifically applies to Customfield Type containing multiple fields.

I've attached the Custom field plugin that helps user to store multiple addresses as part of Issue. Will take that as example to explain the problem. Please do use

-> Each address is consists of Street, City and Zip code. All are three individual text fields. 
-> Using searcher (ExactAddressSearcher) available I can search on complete address. That's good till there.

Here are couple of issues that will use as reference:

Issue Number | Street | City | Zip Code
--------------------------------------------------
Issue 1 | Tasman | San Jose | 94533
Issue 1 | Manning St. | Santa Clara | 34343
Issue 2 | Cricket St  | Sydney | 11132
Issue 2 | Brooks Blvd | Tasman | 22343

Now if I search for "San Jose" I will get correct issue (issue 1).

Let's say that I just want to search for all issues with with street name = "Tasman". Expectation is I should get only "Issue 1" in result. But I will get both issues in search result, this is because Tasman is available in both issues as part of Street or City name.

And currently (as per my understanding) JIRA doesn't provide any way to do search on sub fields. 

Can you please add this functionality or help us to find out if there is any work around.

thanks,
Raju
fields.summary: Customfield Type Search based on subfields (Developer Feature Request)
Add the ability to set the sort with Smart Query in the Quick Search
Quick Copy Issue Number and Title

fields.description:
I don't seem to be able to archive, unarchive and unrelease project versions: when I click the appropriate link on the version's drop down menu, nothing happens. The same issue occurs in Chrome 14, Firefox 7 and IE 9.

Clicking "Release" does bring up the dialog, but the spinner shown after pressing the "Release" button never stops, dialog does not close and version does not get released.

Bumping priority to critical, because the issue prevents us from releasing version 0.3.0 of the JUnitBenchmarks library we're developing (http://issues.carrot2.org/browse/JUNITBENCH).
fields.summary: Unable to release, archive, unarchive and unrelease project version

fields.description:
If you are using Convert to Sub Task (and Convert to Issue, I imagine) on an instance where you have never viewed an issue, the Issue Picker you use doesn't work, because there are no issues in your history. What's bad is that the failure is silent - no popup/select list shows up to tell you that you have no issues in your history.

There's also a slight visual glitch in that the text around the issue picker shrinks slightly when you begin to type into the issue picker.
fields.summary: Convert to Sub Task issue picker fails silently when there are no issues in history

fields.description:
The SOAP API is returning the wrong url for me to use for things like icons and project urls.

for example:

JIRA is hosted on http://192.168.1.134:2990/jira 
the SOAP url is located at: http://192.168.1.134:2990/jira/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2.
I can browse to a project at: http://192.168.1.134:2990/jira/browse/TEST 

The SOAP API in JIRA 5.0 returns urls based on http://192.168.1.134:2990/browse/TEST (notice the lack of /jira/) rather than http://192.168.1.134:2990/jira/browse/TEST, and appears to ignore the rest of the path.

This issue also occurs for priority, type, and status icons.

It's also worth noting that I've tested this against JIRA 4.2, 4.3 and 4.4 and it behaves as it should.
fields.summary: SOAP API for 5.0 ignores full path in urls that it returns

fields.description:
The projects gadget plugin has autoscroll enabled for the dropdown that appears when you click on the icons at the top right of each project.

But when you have lots of projects (we have more than 100), this autoscroll is very annoying and inhibits every possible action on the dropdown.

There must be some way of keeping the autoscroll to enable the dropdown to be entirely visible, but in the mean time we fixed this by disabling autoscroll entirely.

Adding in jira-project/jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/gadgets/project-gadget.xml the variable autoScroll: false in the call AJS.Dropdown.create :

AJS.Dropdown.create({
 trigger: this,
 autoScroll: false,
 ajaxOptions:
fields.summary: Automatic scroll on the hover of the projects gadget plugin dropdown

fields.description:
The diff view in the changelog sent with email notifications is clumsy when accents are involved in the changes.

The reason is that the accents are considered by the diff tool as word separators, and not as part of words.

The correction is quite simple in jira-project/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/diff/WordLevelDiffer.java : replace 
Pattern.compile("[\\p{Alnum}_]+|\\S|(\r\n|\r|\n)") with Pattern.compile("[\\p{L}\\p{Digit}_]+|\\S|(\r\n|\r|\n)") to match the non-ascii characters.
fields.summary: The changelog in notification emails is clumsy when accents are within the changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25869].
  {panel}

It would be most helpful if actions would automatically include a snippet/markup for the comment showing that the comment in the end was related to a specific action.

Example 1:
Adding a image with a comment merely adds a image and a comment. Yes this sounds exactly right, however, if there are many comments already existing, the comment gets lost. There's nothing indicating that comment was related to a specific image/attachment. When you click on the image, it takes over the screen showing the image, but the comment is not shown as a caption around the image. 

Example 2:
Resolving an issue with a comment does not refer back to the actual action of actually resolving. 

I understand that I could be labeling my comments appropriately at the beginning, but that is only if I do it. Company wide, I cannot guarantee that they will all look the same or even done by other users.
fields.summary: Tie Comments Back To Actions and Vice Versa or Automatically Prepend Related Info

fields.description:
Using command + C (cmd+C) to copy text when browsing an issue does not work. This applies to any text in the page. The pasteboard retains its old content.
Right-clicking and selecting "Copy" works.
It works fine on issues on jira.atlassian.com, but on our own onjira.com installation, it does not work.

Disabling the JIRA keyboard shortcuts does not work around the issue. Other users of our onjira installation are experiencing the same problem with same browser.
fields.summary: Command + C doesn't copy in Chrome on hosted JIRA
Change Dashboard ownership

fields.description:
We just upgrade the QA instance of SAC from 4.3 to 4.4.2, and noticed that some but not all of our custom field data didn't migrate correctly.  We have a number of "Select List" custom fields.  We had to update a lot of reports to use the new customfieldoption table instead of the customfieldvalue table.  While doing that, we noticed that some of the data was stored as links to customfieldoption, and the rest was stored as actual values.

Please confirm whether it would be harmful to have a mix of the old and new conventions.

Also, please ping us if logs from our migration would help in tracking this down.
fields.summary: Some custom field values not migrated to customfieldoption table during 4.4.2 upgrade....

fields.description:
I have been using PocketJIRA happily for a long time. SInce upgrading to JIRA v4.4.1#660-r161644 when I try and view an issue I get net.java.ao.sql.ActiveObjectSqlException: Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'DEFAULT'

I've logged this with PocketJIRA but I thinks it's more your end...
fields.summary: Error accessing JIRA using PocketJIRA

fields.description:
JIRA provides the ability to install plugins that contain custom user formats.  When you install one in JIRA 4.4.1, it appears under "Administration" > "User Interface" > "Look and Feel", but you don't get the option to select it when editing the settings.  In fact, no user formats (including the default) appear on the configuration screen.  See the screen shots for details.

To reproduce this:
# build the jira-reference-plugin included with the 4.4.1 source 
# install it in 4.4.1
# Navigate to "Administration" > "User Interface" > "Look and Feel". Note that the user formats provided by the reference plugin are all listed.
# Click "Edit Configuration"
# Expand the "Customize Colors and Dates" section and scroll down.  Note that the user formats do not appear and are not selectable.

I'm not sure if this is a flaw in the reference plugin or JIRA 4.4.1, either way, it needs to be addressed.

The documentation for the plugin module type is also out of date:

https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/User+Format+Plugin+Module

Whatever the correct process is for installing and configuring these, it needs to be reflected in the developer documentation when all is said and done.
fields.summary: Custom User Formats cannot be selected using the administrative interface...

fields.description:
{panel}this has been moved across to JDOG to try and get it fixed in 5.0.  it could be backported to branch if that is not too risky{panel}

If a plugin developer registers an own CustomFieldSearcher and implements getSorter, the returned LuceneFieldSorter is being cached by Lucene. This cache isn't cleared when the plugin reloads, which causes a memory leak.

In addition to that, if the custom field is part of the issue navigator configuration, the old sorter from the dead classloader is used and can cause errors similar to this, breaking the issue nav:

An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getHtml' in class com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.column.ColumnLayoutItemImpl
fields.summary: Custom LuceneFieldSorter created by plugins don't get flushed on plugin restart

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25826].
  {panel}

I have a script which is trying to edit the summary of a closed issue.

The error message I'm getting back is:

Error Messages: [You do not have permission to edit issues in this project.]: <SOAPpy.Types.structType detail at 74695672>: {'hostname': 'extranet-jira.private.atlassian.com', 'com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteException': ''}>

This is not strictly true; the user in question does have permission to edit issues in that project. I'm assuming that the actual error here is that closed issues can't be edited, and the error handling doesn't sufficiently disambiguate between being unable to edit because of permissions vs being unable to edit because the issue is closed.
fields.summary: Misleading error message when trying to edit a closed issue

fields.description:
You can give any valid date to JIRA and if the database stores it then it will be accepted.  Not all databases that we support have the same range of date support, and data import errors can occur when moving from one db to another.  For instance examine https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST-26302 0 - this appeasr to have a due date of 11/Jan/00, but on closer examination you will find this was created by SOAP and actually has the date "0800-01-07 15:55:28+10:04:52". This stores fine in Postgres, but when trying to import the XML export into MS SQL Server you get the following exception...

{code}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Issue][summary,TEST][status,5][votes,0][resolution,2][type,2][resolutiondate,2011-08-03 23:18:06.842][id,131989][reporter,test_automation_user][project,10420][created,2011-04-26 15:41:13.657][updated,2011-08-03 23:18:06.87][workflowId,290606][priority,4][duedate,0800-01-07 15:50:36.0][watches,0][key,TST-26302] (SQL Exception while setting value:  (Only dates between January 1, 1753 and December 31, 9999 are accepted.))
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:133)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.insert(GenericDAO.java:98)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.create(GenericHelperDAO.java:64)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:489)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:469)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue.create(GenericValue.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.OfbizImportHandler.createWithDeadlockRetry(OfbizImportHandler.java:515)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.OfbizImportHandler$1.run(OfbizImportHandler.java:481)
	... 6 more
{code}
{panel:title=Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE} 
Please refer the knowledge article [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/XML+Import+to+MS+SQL+fails+due+to+a+GenericEntityException+-+Date+Format+Error] which explains the workaround to prevent this error.
{panel}
fields.summary: Date validation needs to be tightened up - at the moment we rely on the backend database too much

I was editing/configuring the system dashboard and accidentally browsed away while saving an edit.  When I returned all dashboards were blank.  Attempts to edit or copy any dashboard are all blank canvases.

firebug shows this error message: 
  uncaught exception: [Exception... ""  nsresult: "0x805e000a (<unknown>)"  location: "JS frame :: http://jira.firebare.org/jira/s/en_USdbfmbj/649/1/3.1.7/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard:dashboard/com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard:dashboard.js :: anonymous :: line 7"  data: no]

this problem does not appear with other browsers, or the same browser used from another account.  The problem persists over a variety of browser themes.  I flushed browser cache and cookies and the problem persists.  I see no errors in the server logs.  The integrity checker shows no anomalies. There's some duff data stuck somewhere in the system.  Where/how can it be cleared?

fields.description:
At the moment, JIRA has the following in the entitymodel.xml:
{noformat}
<index unique="true" name="uk_group_name_dir_id">
            <index-field name="lowerGroupName"/>
            <index-field name="directoryId"/>
        </index
{noformat}

This does not allow JIRA to retrieve same groupname with different case. For example:
# in LDAP, group "GroupA" and "groupa" do exist
# previous to version JIRA 4.4.1, when JIRA try to retrieve the group during synchronization it is failed
fields.summary: Allow JIRA To Retrieve Same Group Name With Different Case From LDAP

fields.description:
Currently, special characters are not correctly encode in XML/RSS view.
Here's what appears in the XML:
{noformat}
<customfieldvalue key="10002">1 & 2</customfieldvalue>
{noformat}

whereas it should be:
{noformat}
<customfieldvalue key="10002">1 & 2</customfieldvalue>
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce:
# Add custom field of type *Select List*.
# Add value {{1 & 2}} to the list for that field.
# Add field to a screen.
# Edit any issue and select value '1 & 2' for that custom field.
# Go to issue navigator.
# Make sure the issue is visible on the list in issue navigator.
# Select 'XML' or 'RSS' from the View drop down.

Only reproducible in JIRA 4.4 and 4.4.1
fields.summary: JIRA does not Correctly Encode Special Characters in XML/RSS View

From a Support case:
{quote}
By the way, there is no documentation on atlassian's site to enable client authentication on Tomcat (JIRA). I had to use one of the many sites on the web that explain it (e.g., http://threebit.net/mail-archive/tomcat-users/msg06848.html, http://www.digicert.com/ssl-certificate-installation-tomcat.htm, etc.). The good thing is that JIRA's build already supported it. It just had to be configured manually. Here's what the specific portion of my server.xml looks like:

<Connector port="8443" protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol"
maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" SSLEnabled="true"
maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" maxSpareThreads="75"
enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
clientAuth="true" sslProtocol="TLS" useBodyEncodingForURI="true" 
truststoreFile="C:\.keystore" />
{quote}

We need to update the [SSL documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS] to include this for future references.
fields.summary: Update SSL documentation to include how to enable client auth on Tomcat
Update STP (support tools plugin) to 2.9.3

fields.description: In the WikiRendererFactory it assembles renderable components and sets them into the atlassian-renderer code. However it puts all the system ones first followed by the plugin ones. This is bad because the rendering code relies on a token replacement mechanism to be ran last. This is done via com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.TokenRendererComponent. But if a plugin uses this facility {code} context.getRenderedContentStore().addInline("" + foo + "") {code} Then the token will not be replaced as intended because the TokenRendererComponent is run before plugins components and not after. I think this shows that no one has written many renderable components in JIRA. It works but not the way it is intended to work.
fields.summary: WikiRendererFactory has a renderable component ordering bug

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25809].
  {panel}

To avoid the notification email jumping around as the images load the sizes (or at the very least the height) should be specified on the images so that the email client can leave the appropriate amount of room for the images to load. This is particularly noticeable on:
* the logo in the blue bar at the top
* user avatars
* icons
fields.summary: Image dimensions in email notifications should have sizes specified

fields.description:
Screen recording: http://screencast.com/t/lA8hqrCY1bW

- Go to user profile screen
- Click on the pencil icon next to avatar (Choose an Avatar dialog appears)
- Upload an avatar file
- Select one of the built-in avatars
- Open the dialog again
- Select the custom avatar

*Expected*: either a) the custom avatar should not had been there because I never applied the change, or b) the avatar to be selected

*Actual*: dialog disappears and loading overlay blocks interaction with UI and stays that way forwever

Notes: 
- I mark it as major because it gives the impression that the product is broken.
- JS error reported in console:
{code}
POST https://qa-sample.jira-dev.com/rest/internal/1.0/user/testuser/avatar/ 404 (Not Found)
batch.js:194ajax[58358447] error : { successful : false, status : 404, statusText : error, hasData : true, readyState : 4, requestId : 58358447, aborted : undefined, }
{code}

fields.description:
When Jira is added as Intranet zone on Internet Explorer, compatibility mode is enabled. Since Jira doesn't work properly with compatibility view, it shows some drop downs expropriated. 

[here|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-90350] goes an ticket to exemplify it.

If you need any further information just ask for it!

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Drop down menus from top tabs don't work in IE9 because compatibility mode is forced when Jira is added as intranet.

fields.description: In case of slow connection multiple clicks in \[edit] button are possible in issue display view. Each clicks generates a new semi-transparent area over entire screen causing the background to be darker and passive (not clickable). However, after confirming or cancelling the edit form pop-up, only the last created area is removed while the rest remains and cause the page to be dark and not clikable.
fields.summary: Permanent screen darkening on multiple 'edit' clicks for labels
